gcci.text: At $3.22/hr for H100, utilization remains high amid constrained supply, reflecting persistent chip scarcity and the capex-heavy path to scale.

gtpi.text: At $1.35 per million input tokens, the market is pricing in aggressive efficiency gains and a fast-moving API price war that favors models with superior cost-performance.

gagl.text: An annual load of 120 TWh underscores grid strain, pushing utilities toward nuclear baseload and cleaner firm power to curb emissions.

aipi.text: With falling token prices offset by rising energy loads, sustainability depends on structural efficiency gains and reliable low-carbon power to prevent bubble conditions.
